Package com.taco.suit_lady.util.tools.fx_tools

Class FXTools

java.lang.Object
com.taco.suit_lady.util.tools.fx_tools.FXTools
public class FXTools extends Object
Contains a variety of classes that provide JavaFX utility features.

    • runFX

      public void runFX​(Runnable runnable, boolean wait)
      Runs the specified Runnable on the JavaFX Thread.
      Parameters:
      runnable - The Runnable to be executed.
      wait - True if this method should block until the Runnable is finished execution, false if this method should return as soon as the Runnable has been published. //

    • runFX

      public <V> V runFX​(Callable<V> callable)
      Runs the specified Callable on the JavaFX Thread, and then returns its result when it is done.
      Parameters:
      callable - The Callable to be executed.

    • runEDT

      public void runEDT​(Runnable runnable, boolean wait)
      Runs the specified FXRunnable on the EDT. If the current thread is already the EDT, this method simply calls the run() method of the specified Runnable.

      This method is exceptionally useful for starting background threads that aren't terminated by TRiBot on the end of the script.

      Parameters:
      runnable - The FXRunnable being executed.
      wait - True if this method should block until the Runnable is finished execution, false if this method should return as soon as the Runnable has been published.

    • runEDT

      public <V> V runEDT​(Callable<V> callable)
      Runs the specified Callable on the JavaFX Thread, and then returns its result when it is done.
      Parameters:
      callable - The Callable to be executed.

    • combineToFlow

      public javafx.scene.text.TextFlow combineToFlow​(javafx.scene.text.TextFlow textFlow, Object... objs)
      Combines the children Nodes of the specified TextFlows into a single TextFlow and then returns the result.
      Parameters:
      objs - The Nodes being combined. This array can contain any of the following:
      1. An ArrayList of Nodes.
      2. An array of Nodes.
      3. A Node.
      4. A HyperlinkNodeFX.
      Returns:
      The children Nodes of the specified TextFlows combined into a single TextFlow.

    • numberTextField

      public javafx.scene.control.TextField numberTextField​(javafx.scene.control.TextField textField, boolean allowDecimals)
      Converts the specified TextField into a Number Text Field.

      A Number Text Field will only accept numbers as input, as well as "k", "m", and "b" to denote thousands, millions, and billions, respectively.
      The text field will automatically update when the TextField loses focus or when the user presses enter.

      The default value of the TextField is 0.

      Parameters:
      textField - The TextField.
      allowDecimals - True if the TextField should allow doubles, false if the TextField should be limited to integers only.
      Returns:
      The converted TextField (the same TextField that was passed as a parameter).

    • numberTextField

      public javafx.scene.control.TextField numberTextField​(javafx.scene.control.TextField textField, boolean allowDecimals, double initialValue)
      Converts the specified TextField into a Number Text Field.

      A Number Text Field will only accept numbers as input, as well as "k", "m", and "b" to denote thousands, millions, and billions, respectively.
      The text field will automatically update when the TextField loses focus or when the user presses enter.

      Parameters:
      textField - The TextField.
      allowDecimals - True if the TextField should allow doubles, false if the TextField should be limited to integers only.
      initialValue - The initial value of the TextField.
      Returns:
      The converted TextField (the same TextField that was passed as a parameter).

    • constructButtonMenu

      public void constructButtonMenu​(javafx.scene.control.Menu menu, javafx.scene.control.Button button, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.event.ActionEvent> handler)
      Turns the specified Menu into a Menu Button using the specified Button.}
      Parameters:
      menu - The Menu being turned into a Menu Button.
      button - The Button. Null to create a new Button. Set the name of the Button to empty if you want to use the existing name of the Menu.
      handler - The EventHandler for when the Button is pressed. Null to use the default handler of the specified Button.

    • constructUpdatableWebView

      public void constructUpdatableWebView​(javafx.scene.web.WebView webView, javafx.beans.value.ObservableStringValue observable, javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue... updaters)
      Sets the specified WebView to be updatable.

      This is the same as calling updateWebView(webView, new SimpleObjectProperty<>(observable), updaters)).

      Parameters:
      webView - The WebView.
      observable - The ObservableStringValue that will retrieve the information for the WebView.
      updaters - Any observable values that will trigger an update when changed. Leave empty to only observe the specified ObservableStringValue.

    • constructUpdatableWebView

      public void constructUpdatableWebView​(javafx.scene.web.WebView webView, javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<? extends javafx.beans.value.ObservableStringValue> observable, javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue... updaters)
      Sets the specified WebView to be updatable.
      Parameters:
      webView - The WebView.
      observable - The ObservableValue that will retrieve the information for the WebView.
      updaters - Any observable values that will trigger an update when changed. Leave empty to only observe the specified ObservableValue.

    • getIntValue

      public int getIntValue​(javafx.scene.control.TextField textField)
      Returns the integer value from the specified TextField.

      If the specified TextField does not contain a valid number (included numbers defined by "k" and "m"), this method throws an exception.

      Parameters:
      textField - The TextField.
      Returns:
      The integer value from the specified TextField.

      Edits the children of the specified Parent.
      Parameters:
      parent - The Parent.
      editable - The FXTools.ChildEditable that is to be used to edit the children.
      includeParents - True if the parents should also be included, false otherwise.

    • getChildren

      public ArrayList<javafx.scene.Node> getChildren​(javafx.scene.Parent parent, boolean includeParents)
      Returns all of the children Nodes of the specified Parent.

      This method uses a deep search, so all children, grandchildren, etc will be included in the search.

      Parameters:
      parent - The Parent.
      includeParents - True if the parents should also be included, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      All of the children Nodes of the specified Parent.

    • setAllEnabled

      public void setAllEnabled​(javafx.scene.Parent parent, boolean enabled, javafx.scene.Node... excludes)
      Sets all of the editable child Nodes of the specified Parent to be enabled or disabled.
      Parameters:
      parent - The Parent that is being enabled or disabled.
      enabled - True if all of the editable Nodes should be enabled, false if they should be disabled.
      excludes - An array of Nodes that should not be affected by this method.

    • showTooltip

      public void showTooltip​(javafx.stage.Stage owner, javafx.scene.control.Control control, String tooltipText, boolean consumeAutoHidingEvents)
      Shows a temporary Tooltip for the specified Control.

      While the temporary Tooltip is being shown, if the Control already had a Tooltip, that Tooltip will not be shown.

      When the temporary Tooltip is hidden for any reason, the Tooltip of the Control is set back to its original Tooltip.

      Parameters:
      owner - The Stage owner of the specified Control.
      control - The Control in which the temporary Tooltip is being shown for.
      tooltipText - The getText the temporary Tooltip is to display.
      consumeAutoHidingEvents - True if events that would normally hide the Tooltip should be consumed, false otherwise (a normal Tooltip).

      See PopupWindow.setConsumeAutoHidingEvents(boolean)

    • createTooltip

      public javafx.scene.control.Tooltip createTooltip​(String text)
      Creates a new Tooltip with the specified text.
      Parameters:
      text - The text.
      Returns:
      A new Tooltip with the specified text.

    • onClick

      public javafx.scene.control.ContextMenu onClick​(javafx.scene.Node node, boolean handlePrevious, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onClick, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onDoubleClick, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> onMiddleClick, SimplePredicate popupCondition, javafx.scene.control.MenuItem... items)
      Applies the specified onClick properties to the specified Node.

      This method does nothing and returns null if the specified Node

      Parameters:
      node - The Node.
      handlePrevious - True if the previous properties of the Node should continue to be fired, false if they should be overwritten.
      onClick - EventHandler executed when the Node is clicked. Null to not add an EventHandler.
      onDoubleClick - EventHandler executed when the Node is double-clicked. Null to not add an EventHandler.
      onMiddleClick - EventHandler executed when the Node is middle-clicked. Null to not add an EventHandler.
      popupCondition - The condition that must be true in order for the popup menu to appear. Null to always should the popup menu.
      items - The menu items to be added to the popup menu.
      Returns:
      The fully implemented popup menu created for and attached to the specified Node.

    • bindToParent

      public <T extends javafx.scene.layout.Region> T bindToParent​(@NotNull T child, @NotNull @NotNull javafx.scene.layout.Region parent, boolean addTo)

    • bindToParent

      public <T extends javafx.scene.layout.Region> T bindToParent​(@NotNull T child, @NotNull @NotNull javafx.scene.layout.Region parent, @NotNull @NotNull FXTools.BindOrientation bindOrientation, @NotNull @NotNull FXTools.BindType bindType, boolean addTo)

    • bindToParent

      public <T extends javafx.scene.layout.Region> T bindToParent​(@NotNull T child, @NotNull @NotNull javafx.scene.layout.Region parent, @Nullable @Nullable javafx.beans.value.ObservableDoubleValue observableOffset, @NotNull @NotNull FXTools.BindOrientation bindOrientation, @NotNull @NotNull FXTools.BindType bindType, boolean addTo)

    • bindToParent

      public <T extends javafx.scene.layout.Region> T bindToParent​(@NotNull T child, @NotNull @NotNull javafx.scene.layout.Region parent, boolean includePadding, boolean includeInsets, @NotNull @NotNull FXTools.BindOrientation bindOrientation, @NotNull @NotNull FXTools.BindType bindType, boolean addTo)

    • bindToParent

      public <T extends javafx.scene.layout.Region> T bindToParent​(@NotNull T child, @NotNull @NotNull javafx.scene.layout.Region parent, boolean includePadding, boolean includeInsets, @Nullable @Nullable javafx.beans.value.ObservableDoubleValue observableOffset, @NotNull @NotNull FXTools.BindOrientation bindOrientation, @NotNull @NotNull FXTools.BindType bindType, boolean addTo)

      Binds the specified child to the specified parent using the specified FXTools.BindOrientation and FXTools.BindType rules.

      Details

      1. If addTo is true, the specified child will be added to the specified parent as a child element.
        • If addTo is true, then the specified Region must be an instance of Pane.
        • If addTo is true and the specified Region is not an instance of Pane, an exception is thrown.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The Region Implementation of the child element.
      Parameters:
      child - The child element.
      parent - The parent element that the child is being bound to in size.
      includePadding - True if padding should be counted in size calculations, false if it should not.
      includeInsets - True if insets should be counted in size calculations, false if they should not.
      observableOffset - An ObservableValue that defines any additional size modifications that should be added to the child's calculated dimensions. If null, then an offset of 0 is used.
      bindOrientation - The FXTools.BindOrientation defining which parent dimensions the child should be bound to.
      bindType - The FXTools.BindType defining which child dimension properties should be bound to the parent. Options are Pref. Width and Pref. Height, Max Width and Max Height, or all of the above.
      addTo - True if the child element should be automatically added to the specified parent, false if it should not (useful when the child has already been added to the parent upon method call).
      Returns:
      The specified child element. Useful in chained method calls, though this method can be thought of as functionally void.

    • getNodeSize

      public double getNodeSize​(javafx.scene.layout.Region region, boolean includePadding, boolean includeInsets, FXTools.BindOrientation bindOrientation)

    • getNodeSize

      See Also:

    • applyCellFactory

      public <T> void applyCellFactory​(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<T> comboBox)

      This method is automatically called by autoCompleteComboBox(ComboBox, AutoCompleteMode, String).

      For a list of supported types, see getShortText(Object).

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of elements in the specified ComboBox.
      Parameters:
      comboBox - The ComboBox.
      See Also:
      getShortText(Object), autoCompleteComboBox(ComboBox, AutoCompleteMode, String)

    • addEnumsToComboBox

      public <T extends Enum> void addEnumsToComboBox​(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<T> comboBox, T t, boolean selectFirst, T... excludeValues)
      Deprecated.
      Because this method is inefficient - O(n^n)
      Adds all of the enums of the specified enum type to the specified ComboBox, and then sets the selected value to the enum specified.

      If the specified ComboBox or the specified enum is null, this method returns silently and does nothing.

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of elements in the specified ComboBox.
      Parameters:
      comboBox - The ComboBox.
      t - The type of enum.
      selectFirst - True if the first value should be selected, false if the specified value should be selected.
      excludeValues - The values that should be excluded from the ComboBox.

    • getShortText

      public String getShortText​(Object obj)
      Returns a getText representation of the specified Object, or null if the specified Object is null.

      This method supports the following:

      1. The Listable interface (uses the Listable.getShortText() method
      2. Enums (uses the StringTools.enumToString(Enum) method)
      3. Non-null Objects (uses the Object.toString() method)
      Parameters:
      obj - The Object.
      Returns:
      A getText representation of the specified Object, or null if the specified Object is null.

    • lockSize

      public boolean lockSize​(javafx.stage.Stage stage, FXDialogTools.SizeType sizeType)
      Locks the size of the specified Stage based on the specified FXDialogTools.SizeType.
      Parameters:

      sizeType - The FXDialogTools.SizeType that controls how the Stage can be resized.
      Returns:
      True if the Stage's size was locked successfully, false otherwise.

    • lockSize

      public boolean lockSize​(javafx.stage.Stage stage, double minWidth, double minHeight)
      Locks the size of the specified Stage to the specified minWidth and minHeight.
      Parameters:
      stage - The Stage being locked.
      minWidth - The minimum width.
      minHeight - The minimum height.
      Returns:
      True if the Stage's size was locked successfully, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      NO_MIN_SIZE_LOCK, UNBOUNDED_SIZE_LOCK, CURRENT_SIZE_LOCK, NO_CHANGE_SIZE_LOCK

    • lockSize

      public boolean lockSize​(javafx.scene.layout.Region region, FXDialogTools.SizeType sizeType)
      Locks the size of the specified Region based on the specified FXDialogTools.SizeType.

      Note that regions do not have a setResizable() method. This methods:

      • FXDialogTools.SizeType.NON_RESIZEABLE sets the minimum size and maximum size to the current size of the Region.
      • FXDialogTools.SizeType.RESIZEABLE sets the maximum size to Integer.MAX_VALUE.
      Parameters:
      region - The Region being locked.
      sizeType - The FXDialogTools.SizeType that controls how the Region can be resized.
      Returns:
      True if the Region's size was locked successfully, false otherwise.

    • loadFXML

      public <T> javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader loadFXML​(String resource, javafx.fxml.FXMLLoader loader, T controller)
      Loads and then returns a new FXMLLoader for the specified resource path.
      Parameters:
      resource - The resource path.
      loader - The FXMLLoader being loaded. Null to create a new FXMLLoader.
      controller - The controller to be assigned to the returned FXMLLoader. Specify null if the controller is to be set later, or is set via FXML.
      Returns:
      The recently loaded FXMLLoader for the specified resource path.
